p: To identify SMARCA2-regulated ISGs we performed a transcriptome analysis of SMARCA2-depleted A549-MxA cells. Either siSMARCA2- or siNT-treated A549-MxA cells were infected with wild type H5N1 virus (A/Thailand/1(KAN-1)/2004) at an MOI of 1 (Fig. 3a). 24 h post infection cells were harvested, RNA was extracted and after rRNA depletion subjected to mRNA sequencing. 140 host mRNAs were identified as being downregulated by at least 10-fold and as much as 126-fold in siSMARCA2-treated A549-MxA cells (Supplementary Table S5). Gene ontology (GO) term enrichment analysis revealed that the dataset was highly enriched in gene categories associated with IFN alpha and gamma responses (Fig. 3b) which is in line with our previous finding that SMARCA2 is required for establishment of an antiviral state (Fig. 2).
